intro: Angelica erythrocarpa, commonly known as the red-fruited angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by red or reddish-brown berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
